result.execSummary:
The defendant Harlen J Jordan was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Amphetamine/LSD/Psilocin, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(d).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Costs to be paid $50.00 a month commencing 07/15/22 and each month thereafter or penalty of civil judgment for non-payment.

Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

Expunction is conditionally granted upon verification of completion of sentence, payment of all restitution/costs/fees, and no new law violations. The defendant shall file a petition with the Court to verify the successful completion of the sentence.

with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

02:38 PM Defendant Harlen J Jordan in court with attorney John E. German.  Melissa J. Zilavy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Parties have reached an agreement. 
Court conducts plea colloquy.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 1.  Court finds defendant guilty.
Recommendations by the State.  Recommendations by the Defense.

The Court Orders the Following:

Count 1:
1 Day Jail.  (Credit - 1 days).  COURT DEEMS TIME SERVED.

COSTS: $ 243.00
	
DNA Surcharge: $ 200.00

DNA Sample ordered and to be provided immediately if in custody or within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department. 
 
Total costs/fine/forfeiture: to be paid at the rate of $ 50.00  per month commencing 7/15/22.   Failure to pay: will result in a civil judgment.

Expunction is conditionally granted upon verification of payment of all restitution/costs/fees, and no new law violations. The defendant shall file a petition with the Court to verify the successful completion of the sentence.

Adjustment Number: 22A 019699,
Payable Number: 465207,
Receipt Number: 22R 021177,
Amount: $20.00
Pre-trial conference on June 17, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.

03:00 PM Defendant Harlen J Jordan in court, in custody, with attorney Ricardo Tapia.   Abbey Nickolie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is not eligible for State Public Defender representation.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  Court advises of right to an attorney.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 17, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Waukesha County Public Safety Assessment Report filed by Wisconsin Community Services.
